title: Noise-aware Speech Enhancement using Diffusion Probabilistic Model. (arXiv:2307.08029v1 [eess.AS])
abstract: With recent advances of diffusion model, generative speech enhancement (SE) has attracted a surge of research interest due to its great potential for unseen testing noises. However, existing efforts mainly focus on inherent properties of clean speech for inference, underexploiting the varying noise information in real-world conditions. In this paper, we propose a noise-aware speech enhancement (NASE) approach that extracts noise-specific information to guide the reverse process in diffusion model. Specifically, we design a noise classification (NC) model to produce acoustic embedding as a noise conditioner for guiding the reverse denoising process. Meanwhile, a multi-task learning scheme is devised to jointly optimize SE and NC tasks, in order to enhance the noise specificity of extracted noise conditioner. tldr: 本文提出了一种基于噪声感知的语音增强方法，在扩散模型中引入噪声特定信息，通过噪声分类和多任务学习方案来增强噪声调节器的噪声特异性。证实该方法在VoiceBank-DEMAND数据集上取得了良好的实验效果。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a noise-aware speech enhancement approach that introduces noise-specific information into the diffusion model, enhances the noise specificity of the noise conditioner through noise classification and multi-task learning, and achieves good experimental results on the VoiceBank-DEMAND dataset.
